browser-action.name: imported_Press on text input: First Name
browser-action.description:
Press a key on a selector.
Possible parameters are: - selector (required): The selector is a string that point to the elements in the page. Several types of selector are supported: text, CSS, XPath... You can specify several selectors by adding multiple selector parameters to this action. The targeted element will match any of the selectors (OR operator). - key (required): Key to press, can be a simple key, example : 'A' Or a combination with modifiers: 'Control+Shift+C' or 'ArrowLeft+Control' The list of keys are standard values for the KeyboardEvent.key property from the Browser Keyboard API. - delay (optional): Delay in ms between each keydown/keyup sequence. - timeout (optional): Forces the timeout for that action in ms. By default the OpenBrowser defaultTimeout is used. Maximum value is 200000. - frameIndex (optional): Frame index. - frameName (optional): Frame name. - frameSelector (optional): Frame selector. - waitForNavigation.url (optional): URL pattern targeted, ex:http://tricentis.com/.* . The URL being navigated to must match this pattern. Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed. - waitForNavigation.timeout (optional): If applicable, the navigation must occur within the specified timeout in ms. By default the OpenBrowser defaultNavigationTimeout is used. Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed. Maximum value is 200000. - waitForNavigation.until (optional): Allowed values are : COMMIT, DOMCONTENTLOADED, LOAD, NETWORKIDLE. Default value is LOAD. The navigation will be considered done when the specified state is reached. Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed. - waitForDownload (optional): Enable waiting for a download if the parameter is set to true. Default value is "false". - waitForDownload.path (optional): The path where to save the the downloaded file. Can include the filename, i.e : /home/my-downloads/my-downloaded-file.txt - ignoreErrors (optional): Set this option to true to ignore errors for this action. This is useful for handling conditional actions without having to resort to a "If...Then...Else" or a "Try...Catch" block. Default value is "false".
